column4: hi! i've an issue installing server 7.10 on a proliant dl320 g5 w/ embedded sata raid. i've setup a raid 1 but ubuntu still sees 2 physikal hdds and no raid drive. anyone installed on a proliant sata raid?
what's the raid device model?
not too sure about the exact type as it only says "hp embedded smart array sata raid ich7". seems to be an adaptec controller telling by the copyright msg
I'm trying to look up more information on the raid controller at the moment, it might be a bit
do an 'lsmod | grep adpahci' and tell me if you have the adpahci driver loaded
thanks. and helpful link would be fine. browsed the forum already but couldn't find anything helpful, only someone with the same prob
will so, one sec
not loaded
i'm checking this from export mode - execute a shell. is that correct?

The problem is that the driver you need is called 'adpahci', and as far as I can tell it is not open source. HP seems to have released it for RHEL, but I haven't found source anywhere yet, still looking but you might be out of luck for that raid device
telling from the forum installation seems to work with some v6 release of ubunto. but seems they used a different raid controller then
still looking through HP's notes, as a side note I dislike HP
found some notes about that driver as well. looks like closed source and available for suse and redhat only

i'd do software raid but i already tried to install just on a single disk for a test. creating the root fs always freezes at 33%. so looks like using ahci only without radi is also not working realiable
hmmm did you set the controller to act as JBOD before you tried to install?
does jbod means "no raid"? :) if it's "raid disabled" then yes
sorry, jbod = just a bunch of disks, yeah, raid disabled =) hmmm

yeah, the driver for that embedded raid device is closed source and I can't find any open source projects working on it. This is likely because the driver just implements most of the raid in software and you wont get much performance gain from a driver that uses the device
i've used win on this server before. disk i/o is a pain anyway on that box :)
i'll try to get it to work with a linux software raid then
sounds good, best of luck
many thanks for your help
